content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code fences and the content inside them
    julia_code_pattern = r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```"s

    # Find all matches of the Julia code pattern in the markdown document
    matches = eachmatch(julia_code_pattern, md)

    # Join all the code blocks together with a newline
    code_blocks = join(map(m -> m.captures[1], matches), "\n\n")

    return code_blocks
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to find all Julia code blocks in the provided markdown string `md`. It extracts the content between the code fences, joins them with two newlines (to separate individual code blocks), and returns the resulting string.
